bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Arthur Powell. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: In the matter of the Petition of Arthur Powell for the writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable George Turner Judge of the Fourth Judicial District of the Territory of Washington.

Your petitioner Arthur Powell shows hereby to your Honor, that your petitioner is illegally restrained of his liberty at Cheney in Spokane County in the Territory of Washington by E.F. Whittier Sheriff of said Spokane County.
That the cause of said restraint is a within issued to the said Sheriff by J.J.L. Peel one of the Justices of the Peace of said Spokane County

That the said restraint is illegal in this that the said J.J.L. Peel as such Justice issued a warrant for the arrest of your petitioner upon the pretended charge of "Horse Stealing" but your petitioner swears that said warrant does not show an offense against the laws of Washington Territory That on the 30th day of April A.D. 1885 your petitioner was arrested upon said warrant taken before said Justice and then and thereby by said Justice examined upon said pretended charge And your petitioner shows to your Honor that the testimony upon said

examination showed that no offense against the laws of the Territory of Washington had been committed, and that there was no probable cause to believe your petitioner to be guilty of any offense, notwithstanding which the said Justice held your petitioner to appear before the Grand Jury of Spokane, Douglas, and Lincoln counties at the next term of the District Court to be held at said Cheney, without any evidence authorizing, or authority so to do, and therefore as aforesaid, illegally an wrongfully committed Your petitoner to the custody of said E.F. Whittier, by whom he is now as aforesaid illegally restrained of his liberty. Petitioner shows to your Honor that at said examination the following named prosecuting witnesses were subpoenaed on the part of the Territory, viz: Newton Gardner Jas G. Brophy Louis Lee E. Murray Wm Martin and John Krenshaw and Newton Thomas and the following named persons were sworn and testified in said examination viz: J.G. Brophy, Newton Thomas William Martin, Louis Lee Arthur Powell John Krenshaw and

Your petitioner therefore prays that a writ of Heabeas Corpus issue to the said E.F. Whittier commanding him to produce your petitioner before your Honor that the said witnesses be summoned and examined and that your petitioner be discharged from said restraint, and your petitioner as in duty bound will ever pray Arthur Powell

Territory of Washington} County of Spokane}
Arthur Powell being first duly sworn on oath doth say that he is the petitioner in the foregoing petition that he had read the said petition knows the content thereof and believes the same to be true. Arthur Powell
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 1st day of May 1885. F.A. Bettes Notary Puclic of Washington Territory

For the Clerk of the District Court. Let the writ issue according to the images of the petitioner returnable before the District Court holding terms at Cheney Co. W.T. on the 5th day of May 1885
George Turner Judge

In RE Arthur Powell
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed May 6-85 Kate W. Feuerbach Clerk By R. Strobach Deputy
